task.title: Working with Upgraded External Systems
task.shortdesc: When an external system is upgraded to a new version, you can continue to use existing pipelines that connected to the previous version of the external system. You simply configure the pipelines to work with the upgraded system.

context.p: For example, let's say that you have pipelines that read from Apache Kafka version 0.9. You upgrade Apache Kafka to version 0.10. You can continue to use the existing pipelines after you configure the Kafka stages to use the Kafka version 0.10 stage library.

Or, let's say that you develop a pipeline to write to Cloudera CDH version 5.8 distribution of Hadoop. Then you export and import the pipeline into a that has the Cloudera CDH version 5.9 stage library installed. You can continue to use the imported pipeline after you configure the appropriate stages to use the Cloudera CDH version 5.9 stage library.

step.cmd: Verify that the new stage library version is installed in .
step.info:
For a tarball installation, you can use the Package Manager or the command line to view or install stage libraries. See or .
For an RPM installation, you must use the command line to view or install stage libraries, as described in .

step.cmd: Open each pipeline that connects to the upgraded external system.
On the General tab for each stage that connects to the external system, select the new stage library version.
